author: petr.smelik
title: Educational videos (adatruth)
description:
Most people don't understand what Cardano is about.

How can we explain the system and the vision to newcomers using real world use cases?

assessments.note:
Such videos can definitely increase the awareness of Cardano, but I do not believe that it will increase the number of proposers, or the number of ideas rapidly. 

This feels more of the marketing of Cardano, rather than the target group are proposers.
The idea behind the proposal is well thought, in the spirit of the overall Cardano/Catalyst vision and has the potential to bring a diverse array of individuals to the ecosystem.
Without a plan to reach people who do not know about Cardano it is hard to see how these videos would address the challenge of bringing in new proposers from outside the community.

I do think that creating educational content bringing the basics of Cardano's ecosystem is very beneficial for all the community. I really wished that this proposal was in other challenge like "catalyst value onboarding", which I imagine would be more valuable.
Maybe it would be interesting to considerate to simultaneous approach: one promoting ADA to outside world, showing, like you said, real world projects that are being developed and the potential of the ecosystem, and the other one a more elucidating series which provide educational content with short videos – one linking to another to create meaning and purpose. This way I think would be beneficial to the community, which would learn and get more engaged (mainly newcomers), and to the outside people, who would get interested first in the potential and projects being developed and then learn how it all works and could be done.

The proposal doesn't directly address how it will attract proposers to Catalyst, although in the comments the Author states that this is the goal of the project.  This is not very consistent with the body of the proposal.  I agree that Catalyst could use more publicity. In my opinion a mroe effective way to accomplish would be to follow paticipants in the Catalyst process and see the results of successful funding.

Since the key metrics of this challenge is to increase media coverage and new member ideas, videos are a great gateway to share information and engage members/non-members. Since way before the pandemic hit, videos started to become more important for learning in a flipped classroom/ blended learning environment. In this proposal, videos are proposed to be used both as educational material as well as for showing success stories/ emotional onboarding, therefore providing two possible pathways of attracting new users. From the trailer provided, I would say that it points more towards a motivational/ emotional aspect as well as transporting the vision of ADA to help people understand, how valuable the project is. Using real world usecases is a very good idea, since one of the key criticisms that is held against Cardano is, that it doesn´t provide smart contracts, yet. So the scope is very useful and can work as a way to promote the idea and give an overview on how active the Cardano Community actually is.

The team behind the proposal seems to be experienced in creating the type of content they intend to produce. The plan is reasonable, well thought and given their experience it is highly likely to succeed.
The proposer has the ability to produce the video's. No marketing plan has been detailed.

The proposer shows that has experience and knows how many crew member and with which knowledge the proposal needs to be done.

The proposal does not specify how it will self-fund afterwards in order to continue creating updates and maintaining the dedicated website – since ADA is still young and is evolving each second. Therefore, if the money ends with paying the crew members, the project would stay static and end?
They seem to lack a technical copywriter or a person capable of understanding and explaining the technology.
The proposer is an established filmmaker and I don't see feasibility issues with the project.   The trailer is simply voiceovers and found footage, which can be assembled with few logistical issues.

The proposer has a relevant experience in creating videos and the example provided is very professional. This is good, as a many videos that are being created come from people that have no experience in actual video producing. So here´s a clear advantage in the proposers background and the objectives of the proposal. The team in the background reflect a typical video-crew as far as I understand and would probably guarantee, that the produced videos are very professional as well. 

Since there is not enough information about the intended content for the videos, I cannot really estimate if the team can cover all the topics that would be necessary to put together the Cardano Ecosystem for new members and outsiders. But even with technical and developer content, a documentary film crew might be able to instruct a developer good enough to explain his or her dApp or project without having the same technical knowledge. 

The proposer already showed commitment by producing a teaser video and there´s already a team in the background, that might already have worked before on other projects, so the objective of creating videos will be conducted by a team of professionals. The financial plan is too broad to review at the moment.
No key metrics were posted, and it is very tricky to trace the number of proposers to the project.

The team has laid out the general direction, the amount of videos per week they intend to produce and a roadmap for all the content. Given all the details, the proposal seems feasible and will probably attract like-minded entrepreneurs.

The author doesn't give a lot of details about the length or content. these details will influence the cost of production greatly. Without more exact details about the conent and cost of projection, it will be difficult to know if Catalyst funds are being used efficiently and productively.

The proposal includes, that there will be 2 videos per week in a three-month period, that will be shared on social media and the website. So auditing the progress can be done very easily.

It might be interesting to collect and provide data from each video to see which videos were viewed the most and from which country, gender…… this would be an additional information that this project could provide since it would give a broad overview on which real world use cases attract the most people. 

The proposal does not include, how the roadmap looks like in terms of organizing meetups with any of the projects that will be portrayed and with two videos per week, I´m thinking that this is a very tight schedule. It would be interesting to get more information about actual content, since right now the scope is still very broad and it would be interesting to know more about the videos that were to be created. I´m also not sure if the videos will be portraying the real-world success stories from the outside, or if the team of the project will be involved. One of the challenges could be to get enough people to participate in a video production in this short amount of time (3 months). Another challenge, as always, is visibility. It would be important to find ways to promote the videos and to share them so community engagement with the project would be important. 

It was mentioned, that as a documentary filmer + crew, a lot of other proposals and ideas might be interested in cooperating, so in general, the experience of the proposer is much needed and appreciated in the community I´d think. I´d always advise, that to create educational content, it´s important to have a diverse team that would in the best-case scenario include a film-maker, a teacher and a developer or whoever is best involved in the content, so the community should always try to build interdisciplinary teams for best results.

solution: Short, precisely articulated educational videos will work as a gateway to Cardano attracting developers / ada holders. Watch trailer below.
experience: I'm a documentary filmmaker with 15 years of TV / film experience. Currently working as director / TV editor. www.vivatscreen.com
